publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4025 Murdo Fraser: Andy Murray British Number 1—That the Parliament congratulates Andy Murray on becoming the British number 1, overtaking fellow Brits, Tim Henman and Greg Rusedski, and being propelled to 42nd in the tennis world rankings after recent success, including beating world-class players such as Andy Roddick and Lleyton Hewitt when winning his first ATP Tour title at the SAP Open in San Jose; believes that his skill and determination shown on the tennis court will inspire many young Scots to take up tennis, and believes that the Scottish Executive, in partnership with schools and parents, should encourage the uptake of more sport and activity for youngsters during and after school. Supported by: Mr David Davidson*, Phil Gallie*, Alex Johnstone*, Nora Radcliffe*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Margaret Mitchell*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S2M-4025 Andy Murray British Number 1 (lodged on 28 February 2006) Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Chris Ballance*, John Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Michael McMahon*, Bruce Crawford*, Mike Pringle*, Shona Robison*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mary Scanlon*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Bristow Muldoon*
S2M-4025 Andy Murray British Number 1 (lodged on 28 February 2006) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Trish Godman*, John Home Robertson*

S2M-4025 Murdo Fraser: Andy Murray British Number 1—That the Parliament congratulates Andy Murray on becoming the British number 1, overtaking fellow Brits, Tim Henman and Greg Rusedski, and being propelled to 42nd in the tennis world rankings after recent success, including beating world-class players such as Andy Roddick and Lleyton Hewitt when winning his first ATP Tour title at the SAP Open in San Jose; believes that his skill and determination shown on the tennis court will inspire many young Scots to take up tennis, and believes that the Scottish Executive, in partnership with schools and parents, should encourage the uptake of more sport and activity for youngsters during and after school. Supported by: Mr David Davidson, Phil Gallie, Alex Johnstone, Nora Radcliffe, Eleanor Scott, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Margaret Mitchell, Mr Jim Wallace, Mr Jamie Stone, Mrs Nanette Milne, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Chris Ballance, John Scott, Shiona Baird, Michael McMahon, Bruce Crawford, Mike Pringle, Shona Robison, Tommy Sheridan, Mary Scanlon, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Mr Brian Monteith, Trish Godman, John Home Robertson
S2M-4025 Andy Murray British Number 1 (lodged on 28 February 2006) Christine Grahame*
S2M-4025 Andy Murray British Number 1 (lodged on 28 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4025 Andy Murray British Number 1 (lodged on 28 February 2006) Linda Fabiani*
